meanings: colleague, co-worker, fellow worker, associate, peer, (Brit) workmate
a colleague at work[in one´s office, in one´s company]

vlive.korean: [동료 연예인들의 뜨거운 응원과] - 세븐틴 친구들이 화환 보내줬네? - 봤어? [Many other celebrities are rooting for SJ] - SEVENTEEN sent us flowers. - Did you see them? 듣기 View video 슈주 리턴즈 (SJ returns) : 슈주 리턴즈3 EP51- [슈퍼쇼8] 어디서도 공개된 적 없는 백스테이지 공개
vlive.english: [Many other celebrities are rooting for SJ] - SEVENTEEN sent us flowers. - Did you see them?

examples.korean: She is held in high esteem by her colleagues. 발음듣기 그녀는 동료들의 많은 존경을 받고 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She is held in high esteem by her colleagues. 발음

examples.korean: He bounced ideas off colleagues everywhere he went. 발음듣기 그는 가는 곳마다 동료들에게 자기 의견을 말해 보았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He bounced ideas off colleagues everywhere he went. 발음

examples.korean: He was offered money to betray his colleagues. 발음듣기 그는 동료들을 밀고하면 돈을 주겠다는 제의를 받았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He was offered money to betray his colleagues. 발음

examples.korean: His outspoken behaviour did not commend itself to his colleagues. 발음듣기 그의 거침없는 태도는 동료들의 호감을 받지 못했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: His outspoken behaviour did not commend itself to his colleagues. 발음

examples.korean: He committed the cardinal sin of criticizing his teammates. 발음듣기 그는 팀 동료를 비판하는, 해서는 안 될 짓을 했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He committed the cardinal sin of criticizing his teammates. 발음
